options.A: shares are the only investment that only provides capital appreciation. Shares are also very liquid as they can be traded in the open market.
options.B: Shares may provide potential good dividends and capital appreciation. However, shares are very liquid as they cannot be traded in the open market.

question: Choose the correct statement.

options.A: Convertible Stocks – The decisions to convert depends on whether dividend income and capital appreciation in share price is better than the fixed interest given.
options.B: Debenture Stocks – The company also has an option not to repay the debenture stocks earlier, if it wishes to do so.
options.C: Loan Stocks – If the company defaults, the investor has all the security and thus is in better position compared to all the other unsecured creditors of the company.
options.D: Treasury Bills – The key difference between government bonds and Treasury bills is the tenure. Treasury bills are issued with a maturity of loner tenure, say 5 to 10 years or even as long as 15 – 20 years whereas the tenure of government bonds is shorter.
